Acid.name: Acid
Acid.description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a vial of Acid. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take 2d6 Acid damage.

Activate Folding Boat.name: Activate Folding Boat
Activate Folding Boat.description:
First Command Word. The box unfolds into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbmobRowboat000]{Rowboat}.

Second Command Word. The box unfolds into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.phbmobKeelboat00]{Keelboat}.

Third Command Word. The Folding Boat folds back into a box if no creatures are aboard. Any objects in the vessel that can't fit inside the box remain outside the box as it folds. Any objects in the vessel that can fit inside the box do so.

When the box becomes a vessel, its weight becomes that of a normal vessel its size, and anything that was stored in the box remains in the boat.

Statistics for the Rowboat and Keelboat appear in @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.phbEquipment0000]{Equipment}. If either vessel is reduced to 0 Hit Points, the Folding Boat is destroyed.

Adamantine Armor.name: Adamantine Armor
Adamantine Armor.description:
Armor (Any Medium or Heavy, Except Hide Armor), Uncommon

This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While you're wearing it, any &Reference[CriticalHits] against you becomes a normal hit.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Air Ring of Elemental Command.name: Air Ring of Elemental Command
Air Ring of Elemental Command.description:
Ring, Legendary (Requires Attunement)

Each Ring of Elemental Command is linked to one of the four Elemental Planes. The GM chooses or randomly determines the linked plane. For example, a Ring of Elemental Command (air) is linked to the Elemental Plane of Air.

Every Ring of Elemental Command has the following two properties:

Elemental Bane. While wearing the ring, you have Advantage on attack rolls against Elementals and they have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Elemental Compulsion. While wearing the ring, you can take a Magic action to try to compel an Elemental you see within 60 feet of yourself. The Elemental makes a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the Elemental has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start your next turn, and you determine what it does with its move and action on its next turn.

Elemental Focus. While wearing the ring, you benefit from additional properties corresponding to the ring's linked Elemental Plane:

Air. You know Auran, you have Resistance to Lightning damage, and you have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed and can hover.

Spellcasting. The ring has 5 charges and regains 1d4 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can cast a spell from it. Choose the spell from the list of available spells based on the Elemental Plane the ring is linked to, as shown in the following table. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell, which has a save DC of 18.

Plane

Spells (Charges)

Air

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplChainLight]{Chain Lightning} (3 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFeatherFal]{Feather Fall} (0 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind} (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWindWall00]{Wind Wall} (1 charge)

Alchemist's Fire.name: Alchemist's Fire
Alchemist's Fire.description: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Alchemist's Fire. Target one creature or object you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take [[/damage 1d4 type=fire]] damage and start &Reference[burning].

Alchemist's Supplies.name: Alchemist's Supplies
Alchemist's Supplies.description:
Ability: Intelligence

Utilize: Identify a substance (DC 15), or start a fire (DC 15)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAcid0000000]{Acid}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAlchemistsF]{Alchemist's Fire}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagComponentPo]{Component Pouch}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagOil00000000]{Oil}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPaper000000]{Paper}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPerfume0000]{Perfume}

Ammunition (Varies).name: Ammunition (Varies)
Ammunition (Varies).description:
Ammunition is required by a weapon that has the Ammunition property. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon. The Ammunition table lists the different types and the amount you get when you buy them. The table also lists the item that is typically used to store each type; storage must be bought separately.

Ammunition
TypeAmountStorageWeightCost
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoArrows0000]{Arrows}20@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagQuiver00000]{Quiver}1 lb.1 GP
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoBolts00000]{Bolts}20@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCaseCrossbo]{Case}1½ lb.1 GP
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoBulletsFir]{Bullets, Firearm}10@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPouch000000]{Pouch}2 lb.3 GP
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoBulletsSli]{Bullets, Sling}20@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPouch000000]{Pouch}1½ lb.4 CP
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoNeedles000]{Needles}50@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPouch000000]{Pouch}1 lb.1 GP

Ammunition of Slaying.name: Ammunition of Slaying
Ammunition of Slaying.description:
This magic ammunition is meant to slay creatures of a particular type, which the GM chooses or determines randomly by rolling on the table below. If a creature of that type takes damage from the ammunition, the creature makes a DC 17 Constitution saving throw, taking an extra 6d10 Force damage on a failed save or half as much extra damage on a successful one.

After dealing its extra damage to a creature, the ammunition becomes nonmagical.

Creature Type Table (click to expand)

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgSlayingAmmuni rollable]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Slaying Save.name: Slaying Save
Slaying Save.condition: when the specified creature type is damaged by this ammunition

Ammunition, +1, +2, or +3.name: Ammunition, +1, +2, or +3
Ammunition, +1, +2, or +3.description:
Weapon (Any Ammunition), Uncommon (+1), Rare (+2), or Very Rare (+3)

You have a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this piece of magic ammunition. The bonus is determined by the rarity of the ammunition. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer magical.

This ammunition is typically found or sold in quantities of ten or twenty pieces. Ten pieces of this ammunition are equivalent in value to a potion of the same rarity.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Amulet.name: Amulet
Amulet.description:
Usage Requirement: Worn or held

A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHolySymbolV]{Holy Symbol} takes one of the forms in the Holy Symbol table and is bejeweled or painted to channel divine magic. A Cleric or Paladin can use a Holy Symbol as a Spellcasting Focus.

Amulet of Health.name: Amulet of Health
Amulet of Health.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

Your Constitution is 19 while you wear this amulet. It has no effect on you if your Constitution is 19 or higher without it.

Amulet of Proof against Detection and Lo.name: Amulet of Proof against Detection and Location
Amulet of Proof against Detection and Lo.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this amulet, you can't be targeted by &Reference[schoolsofmagic]{Divination} spells or perceived through magical scrying sensors unless you allow it.

Amulet of the Planes.name: Amulet of the Planes
Amulet of the Planes.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this amulet, you can take a Magic action to name a location that you are familiar with on another plane of existence. Then make a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check. On a successful check, you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift} . On a failed check, you and each creature and object within 15 feet of you travel to a random destination determined by rolling 1d100 and consulting the following table.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgAmuletOfThePl rollable caption=false]

Animated Shield.name: Animated Shield
Animated Shield.description:
Armor (Shield), Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

While holding this Shield, you can take a Bonus Action to cause it to animate. The Shield leaps into the air and hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free. The Shield remains animate for 1 minute, until you take a Bonus Action to end this effect, or until you die or have the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition, at which point the Shield falls to the ground or into your hand if you have one free.

Animated Shield.name: Animated Shield
Animated Shield.description: The Shield hovers in your space to protect you as if you were wielding it, leaving your hands free.

Antitoxin.name: Antitoxin
Antitoxin.description: As a Bonus Action, you can drink a vial of Antitoxin to gain Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Poisoned condition for 1 hour.

Apparatus of the Crab.name: Apparatus of the Crab
Apparatus of the Crab.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary

This item first appears to be a sealed iron barrel weighing 500 pounds. The barrel has a hidden catch, which can be found with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=20]] check. Releasing the catch unlocks a hatch at one end of the barrel, allowing two Medium or smaller creatures to crawl inside. Ten levers are set in a row at the far end, each in a neutral position, able to move up or down. When certain levers are used, the apparatus transforms to resemble a giant lobster.

The @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.dmgApparatusofKw]{Apparatus of the Crab} is a Large object with the following statistics: AC 20; HP 200; Speed 30 ft., Swim 30 ft. (or 0 ft. for both if the legs aren't extended); Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.dmgApparatusofKw caption=false]

Move Levers.name: Move Levers
Move Levers.chatFlavor: Adjust up to two levers up or down

Arcane Focus (Varies).name: Arcane Focus (Varies)
Arcane Focus (Varies).description:
An Arcane Focus takes one of the forms in the Arcane Focuses table and is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Arcane Focuses
FocusWeightCost
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcCrystal000]{Crystal}1 lb.10 GP
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcOrb0000000]{Orb}3 lb.20 GP
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcRod0000000]{Rod}2 lb.10 GP
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcStaffalsoa]{Staff} (also a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepQuartersta]{Quarterstaff})4 lb.5 GP
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcWand000000]{Wand}1 lb.10 GP

Armor of Invulnerability.name: Armor of Invulnerability
Armor of Invulnerability.description:
Armor (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmPlateArmor]{Plate Armor}), Legendary (Requires Attunement)

You have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage while you wear this armor.

Metal Shell. You can take a Magic action to give yourself Immunity to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Metal Shell.name: Metal Shell
Metal Shell.description: You have Immunity to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage for 10 minutes or until you are no longer wearing the armor.

Armor of Resistance.name: Armor of Resistance
Armor of Resistance.description:
Armor (Any Light, Medium, or Heavy), Rare (Requires Attunement)

You have Resistance to one type of damage while you wear this armor. The GM chooses the type or determines it randomly by rolling on the following table.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgArmorOfResist rollable caption=false]

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Armor of Vulnerability.name: Armor of Vulnerability
Armor of Vulnerability.description:
Armor (Any Light, Medium, or Heavy), Rare (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this armor, you have Resistance to one of the following damage types: Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing. The GM chooses the type or determines it randomly.

Curse. This armor is cursed, a fact that is revealed only when the Identify spell is cast on the armor or you attune to it. Attuning to the armor curses you until you are targeted by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic; removing the armor fails to end the curse. While cursed, you have Vulnerability to two of the three damage types associated with the armor (not the one to which it grants Resistance).

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Armor, +1, +2, or +3.name: Armor, +1, +2, or +3
Armor, +1, +2, or +3.description:
Armor (Any Light, Medium, or Heavy), Rare (+1), Very Rare (+2), or Legendary (+3)

You have a bonus to Armor Class while wearing this armor. The bonus is determined by its rarity.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Arrow-Catching Shield.name: Arrow-Catching Shield
Arrow-Catching Shield.description:
Armor (Shield), Rare (Requires Attunement)

You gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class against ranged attack rolls while you wield this Shield. This bonus is in addition to the Shield's normal bonus to AC.

Whenever an attacker makes a ranged attack roll against a target within 5 feet of you, you can take a Reaction to become the target of the attack instead.

Foundry Note

The Ranged Attack AC Bonus effect is provided for optional use and may be toggled active before a ranged attack roll is made against the wearer.

Intercept Attack.name: Intercept Attack
Intercept Attack.condition: an attacker makes a ranged attack roll against a target within 5 feet of you
Intercept Attack.chatFlavor: You become the target of the ranged attack.

Ranged Attack AC Bonus.name: Ranged Attack AC Bonus
Ranged Attack AC Bonus.description: You gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class against ranged attack rolls while you wield this Shield. This bonus is in addition to the Shield’s normal bonus to AC.

Arrows.name: Arrows
Arrows.description:
Storage: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagQuiver00000]{Quiver}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAmmunitionV]{Ammunition} is required by a weapon that has the Ammunition property. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon. The Ammunition table lists the different types and the amount you get when you buy them. The table also lists the item that is typically used to store each type; storage must be bought separately.

Assassin's Blood.name: Assassin's Blood
Assassin's Blood.description:
Ingested Poison

A creature subjected to Assassin's Blood makes a DC 10 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 6 (1d12) Poison damage and has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

Backpack.name: Backpack
Backpack.description: A Backpack holds up to 30 pounds within 1 cubic foot. It can also serve as a saddlebag.

Bag of Beans.name: Bag of Beans
Bag of Beans.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

This heavy cloth bag contains 3d4 dry beans when found. The bag weighs half a pound regardless of how many beans it contains and becomes a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPouch000000]{nonmagical item} when it no longer contains any beans.

If you dump one or more beans out of the bag, they explode in a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on them. All the dumped beans are destroyed in the explosion, and each creature in the Sphere, including you, makes a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d4 Force damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

If you remove a bean from the bag, plant it in dirt or sand, and then water it, the bean disappears as it produces an effect 1 minute later from the ground where it was planted. The GM can choose an effect from the following table or determine it randomly.

Bag of Beans Effect (click to expand)

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgBagOfBeansEff rollable caption=false]

Foundry Note

Upon obtaining this item, the Count Beans activity can be used to determine the number of dry beans contained within and set this item's number of uses accordingly.

Bag of Devouring.name: Bag of Devouring
Bag of Devouring.description:
This bag resembles a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgBagOfHolding0]{Bag of Holding} but is a feeding orifice for a gigantic extradimensional creature. Turning the bag inside out closes the orifice.

The extradimensional creature attached to the bag can sense whatever is placed inside the bag. Animal or vegetable matter placed wholly in the bag is devoured and lost forever. When part of a living creature is placed in the bag, as happens when someone reaches inside it, there is a [[/r 1dc#Creature pulled in on a 1, or "Heads"]]{50 percent} chance that the creature is pulled inside the bag. A creature inside the bag can take an action to try to escape, doing so with a successful [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=15 format=long]]. Another creature can take an action to reach into the bag to pull a creature out, doing so with a successful [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=20 format=long]], provided the puller isn't pulled inside the bag first. Any creature that starts its turn inside the bag is devoured, its body destroyed.

Inanimate objects can be stored in the bag, which can hold a cubic foot of such material. However, once each day, the bag swallows any objects inside it and spits them out into another plane of existence. The GM determines the time and plane.

If the bag is pierced or torn, it is destroyed, and anything contained within it is transported to a random location on the Astral Plane.

Bag of Holding.name: Bag of Holding
Bag of Holding.description:
This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions—roughly 2 feet square and 4 feet deep on the inside. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 5 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires a Utilize action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it is destroyed, and its contents are scattered in the Astral Plane. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again. The bag holds enough air for 10 minutes of breathing, divided by the number of breathing creatures inside.

Placing a Bag of Holding inside an extradimensional space created by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgHewardsHandyH]{Handy Haversack}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgPortableHole0]{Portable Hole}, or similar item instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within a 10-foot-radius Sphere centered on the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way and can't be reopened.

Bagpipes.name: Bagpipes
Bagpipes.description:
Ability: Charisma

Utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

Balance.name: Balance
Balance.description: You can increase one of your ability scores by 2, to a maximum of 22, provided you also decrease another one of your ability scores by 2. You can't decrease an ability that has a score of 5 or lower. Alternatively, you can choose not to adjust your ability scores, in which case this card has no effect.

Card Effect.name: Card Effect
Card Effect.condition: Card's effect occurs immediately upon draw

Ball Bearings.name: Ball Bearings
Ball Bearings.description:
As a Utilize action, you can spill Ball Bearings from their pouch. They spread to cover a level, 10-foot-square area within 10 feet of yourself. A creature that enters this area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or have the &Reference[Prone] condition. It takes 10 minutes to recover the Ball Bearings.

Foundry Note

The Recover Ball Bearings activity grants another use of this item.

Barrel.name: Barrel
Barrel.description: A Barrel holds up to 40 gallons of liquid or up to 4 cubic feet of dry goods.

Basket.name: Basket
Basket.description: A Basket holds up to 40 pounds within 2 cubic feet.

Bead of Force.name: Bead of Force
Bead of Force.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

This small black sphere measures 3/4 of an inch in diameter and weighs an ounce. Typically, [[/r 1d4 + 4#Beads of Force]] Beads of Force are found together.

You can take a Magic action to throw the bead up to 60 feet. The bead explodes in a 10-foot-radius Sphere on impact and is destroyed. Each creature in the Sphere must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 5d4 Force damage. A sphere of transparent force then encloses the area for 1 minute. Any creature that failed the save and is completely within the area is trapped inside this sphere. Creatures that succeeded on the save or are partially within the area are pushed away from the center of the sphere until they are no longer inside it. Only breathable air can pass through the sphere's wall. No attack or other effect can pass through.

An enclosed creature can take a Utilize action to push against the sphere's wall, moving the sphere up to half the creature's Speed. The sphere can be picked up, and its magic causes it to weigh only 1 pound, regardless of the weight of creatures inside.

Bead of Nourishment.name: Bead of Nourishment
Bead of Nourishment.description:
Wondrous Item, Common

This flavorless, gelatinous bead dissolves on your tongue and provides as much nourishment as 1 day of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRations0000]{Rations}.

Bedroll.name: Bedroll
Bedroll.description: A Bedroll sleeps one Small or Medium creature. While in a Bedroll, you automatically succeed on saving throws against extreme cold (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.xgLA30rErlkjIPAK]{Gameplay Toolbox}).

Bell.name: Bell
Bell.description: When rung as a Utilize action, a Bell produces a sound that can be heard up to 60 feet away.

Belt of Dwarvenkind.name: Belt of Dwarvenkind
Belt of Dwarvenkind.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this belt, you gain the following benefits:

Dwarvish. You know Dwarvish.

Friend of Dwarvenkind. You have Advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with dwarves and duergar.

Toughness. Your Constitution increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.

In addition, while attuned to the belt, you have a 50 percent chance each day at dawn of growing a full beard if you can grow one, or a thicker beard if you already have one.

If you aren't a dwarf or duergar, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Resilience. You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Poisoned condition.

Dwarvenkind Benefits.name: Dwarvenkind Benefits
Dwarvenkind Benefits.description:
Dwarvish. You know Dwarvish.

Friend of Dwarvenkind. You have Advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks made to interact with dwarves and duergar.

Toughness. Your Constitution increases by 2, to a maximum of 20.

If you aren’t a dwarf or duergar, you gain the following additional benefits while wearing the belt:

Darkvision. You have Darkvision with a range of 60 feet.

Resilience. You have Resistance to Poison damage. You also have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Poisoned condition.

Belt of Giant Strength.name: Belt of Giant Strength
Belt of Giant Strength.description:
Wondrous Item, Rarity Varies (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this belt, your Strength changes to a score granted by the belt. The type of giant determines the score (see the table below). The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than the belt's score.

BeltStr.Rarity
Belt of Giant Strength (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmghilBeltofGian]{hill})21Rare
Belt of Giant Strength (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgfroBeltofGian]{frost} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgstoBeltofGian]{stone})23Very Rare
Belt of Giant Strength (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgfirBeltofGian]{fire})25Very Rare

Belt of Giant Strength (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgstmBeltofGian]{storm})29Legendary

Belt of Giant Strength (cloud).name: Belt of Giant Strength (cloud)
Belt of Giant Strength (cloud).description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgBeltOfGiantSt]

While wearing this belt, your Strength changes to 27. The type of giant determines the score. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 27.

Belt of Giant Strength (fire).name: Belt of Giant Strength (fire)
Belt of Giant Strength (fire).description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgBeltOfGiantSt]

While wearing this belt, your Strength changes to 25. The type of giant determines the score. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 25.

Belt of Giant Strength (frost).name: Belt of Giant Strength (frost)
Belt of Giant Strength (frost).description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgBeltOfGiantSt]

While wearing this belt, your Strength changes to 23. The type of giant determines the score. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 23.

Belt of Giant Strength (hill).name: Belt of Giant Strength (hill)
Belt of Giant Strength (hill).description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgBeltOfGiantSt]

While wearing this belt, your Strength changes to 21. The type of giant determines the score. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 21.

Belt of Giant Strength (stone).name: Belt of Giant Strength (stone)
Belt of Giant Strength (stone).description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgBeltOfGiantSt]

While wearing this belt, your Strength changes to 23. The type of giant determines the score. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 23.

Belt of Giant Strength (storm).name: Belt of Giant Strength (storm)
Belt of Giant Strength (storm).description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgBeltOfGiantSt]

While wearing this belt, your Strength changes to 29. The type of giant determines the score. The item has no effect on you if your Strength without the belt is equal to or greater than 29.

Berserker Axe.name: Berserker Axe
Berserker Axe.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepBattleaxe0]{Battleaxe}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreataxe00]{Greataxe}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepHalberd000]{Halberd}), Rare (Requires Attunement)

You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, while you are attuned to this weapon, your Hit Point maximum increases by 1 for each level you have attained.

Curse. This weapon is cursed, and becoming attuned to it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the weapon, keeping it within reach at all times. You also have Disadvantage on attack rolls with weapons other than this one.

Whenever another creature damages you while the weapon is in your possession, you must succeed on a [[/save ability=wis dc=15 format=long]] or go berserk. This berserk state ends when you start your turn and there are no creatures within 60 feet of you that you can see or hear.

While berserk, you regard the creature nearest to you that you can see or hear as your enemy. If there are multiple possible creatures, choose one at random. On each of your turns, you must move as close to the creature as possible and take the Attack action, targeting the creature. If you're unable to get close enough to the creature to attack it with the weapon, your turn ends after you've used up all your available movement. If the creature dies or can no longer be seen or heard by you, the next nearest creature that you can see or hear becomes your new target.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Berserker HP Increase.name: Berserker HP Increase
Berserker HP Increase.description: While you are attuned to this weapon, your Hit Point maximum increases by 1 for each level you have attained.

Blanket.name: Blanket
Blanket.description: While wrapped in a blanket, you have Advantage on saving throws against extreme cold (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000.JournalEntryPage.xgLA30rErlkjIPAK]{Gameplay Toolbox}).

Block and Tackle.name: Block and Tackle
Block and Tackle.description: A Block and Tackle allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

Bolts.name: Bolts
Bolts.description:
Storage: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCaseCrossbo]{Case}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAmmunitionV]{Ammunition} is required by a weapon that has the Ammunition property. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon. The Ammunition table lists the different types and the amount you get when you buy them. The table also lists the item that is typically used to store each type; storage must be bought separately.

Book.name: Book
Book.description: A Book contains fiction or nonfiction. If you consult an accurate nonfiction Book about its topic, you gain a +5 bonus to Intelligence (Arcana, History, Nature, or Religion) checks you make about that topic.

Boots of Elvenkind.name: Boots of Elvenkind
Boots of Elvenkind.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

While you wear these boots, your steps make no sound, regardless of the surface you are moving across. You also have Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Boots of Levitation.name: Boots of Levitation
Boots of Levitation.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

While you wear these boots, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLevitate00]{Levitate} on yourself.

Boots of Speed.name: Boots of Speed
Boots of Speed.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

While you wear these boots, you can take a Bonus Action to click the boots' heels together. If you do, the boots double your Speed, and any creature that makes an Opportunity Attack against you has Disadvantage on the attack roll. If you click your heels together again, you end the effect.

When you've used the boots' property for a total of 10 minutes, the magic ceases to function for you until you finish a Long Rest.

Foundry Note

This item's Limited Uses are provided to manually track the number of seconds the item has been in use.

Boots of Speed Active.name: Boots of Speed Active
Boots of Speed Active.description: The boots double your Speed, and any creature that makes an Opportunity Attack against you has Disadvantage on the attack roll. If you click your heels together again, you end the effect.

Boots of Striding and Springing.name: Boots of Striding and Springing
Boots of Striding and Springing.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While you wear these boots, your Speed becomes 30 feet unless your Speed is higher, and your Speed isn't reduced by you carrying weight in excess of your carrying capacity or wearing Heavy Armor.

Once on each of your turns, you can jump up to 30 feet by spending only 10 feet of movement.

Unburdened Movement.name: Unburdened Movement
Unburdened Movement.description: Your Speed becomes 30 feet unless your Speed is higher, and your Speed isn’t reduced by you carrying weight in excess of your carrying capacity or wearing Heavy Armor.

Boots of the Winterlands.name: Boots of the Winterlands
Boots of the Winterlands.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

These furred boots are snug and feel warm. While wearing them, you gain the following benefits.

Cold Resistance. You have Resistance to Cold damage and can tolerate temperatures of 0 degrees Fahrenheit or lower without any additional protection.

Winter Strider. You ignore Difficult Terrain created by ice or snow.

Cold Resistance.name: Cold Resistance
Cold Resistance.description: You have Resistance to Cold damage and can tolerate temperatures of 0 degrees Fahrenheit or lower without any additional protection.

Winter Strider.name: Winter Strider
Winter Strider.description: You ignore Difficult Terrain created by ice or snow.

Bottle, Glass.name: Bottle, Glass
Bottle, Glass.description: A Glass Bottle holds up to 1½ pints.

Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals.name: Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals
Bowl of Commanding Water Elementals.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

While this bowl is filled with water and you are within 5 feet of it, you can take a Magic action to summon a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmWaterElemental]{Water Elemental}. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the bowl as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your Initiative count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a Bonus Action. The bowl can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

The bowl is about 1 foot in diameter and half as deep. It holds about 3 gallons.

Bracers of Archery.name: Bracers of Archery
Bracers of Archery.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While wearing these bracers, you have proficiency with the Longbow and Shortbow, and you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls made with such weapons.

Foundry Note

The Bonus Damage: Bows passive effect applies the damage bonus to all ranged weapon damage rolls and should be disabled before rolling damage for weapons other than a Longbow or Shortbow.

Bonus Damage: Bows.name: Bonus Damage: Bows
Bonus Damage: Bows.description: you gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls on ranged attacks made with a Longbow or Shortbow

Bracers of Defense.name: Bracers of Defense
Bracers of Defense.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

While wearing these bracers, you gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class if you are wearing no armor and using no Shield.

Brass Horn of Valhalla.name: Brass Horn of Valhalla
Brass Horn of Valhalla.description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgHornofValhall]{Horn of Valhalla}

Requirement: Proficiency with all Simple weapons

Spirits: 3

You can take a Magic action to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you. Each spirit uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmBerserker00000]{Berserker} stat block and returns to Ysgard after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 Hit Points. The spirits look like living, breathing warriors, and they have Immunity to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Frightened apply=false] conditions. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned spirits attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are Friendly to you and your allies and follow your commands.

Horn of Valhalla: Condition Immunity.name: Horn of Valhalla: Condition Immunity
Horn of Valhalla: Condition Immunity.description: The spirits look like living, breathing warriors, and they have Immunity to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Frightened apply=false] conditions.

Brazier of Commanding Fire Elementals.name: Brazier of Commanding Fire Elementals
Brazier of Commanding Fire Elementals.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

While you are within 5 feet of this brazier, you can take a Magic action to summon a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmFireElemental0]{Fire Elemental}. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the brazier as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your Initiative count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a Bonus Action. The brazier can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Brewer's Supplies.name: Brewer's Supplies
Brewer's Supplies.description:
Ability: Intelligence

Utilize: Detect poisoned drink (DC 15), or identify alcohol (DC 10)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAntitoxin00]{Antitoxin}

Bronze Griffon.name: Bronze Griffon
Bronze Griffon.description:
See @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgFigurineOfWon]{Figurine of Wondrous Power}

This bronze statuette is of a griffon rampant. It can become a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmGriffon0000000]{Griffon} for up to 6 hours. Once it has been used, it can't be used again until 5 days have passed.

Foundry Note

This item's limited uses represent the 5 days required before the figurine can be used again.

Bronze Horn of Valhalla.name: Bronze Horn of Valhalla
Bronze Horn of Valhalla.description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgHornofValhall]{Horn of Valhalla}

Requirement: Training with all Medium armor

Spirits: 4

You can take a Magic action to blow this horn. In response, warrior spirits from the plane of Ysgard appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you. Each spirit uses the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmBerserker00000]{Berserker} stat block and returns to Ysgard after 1 hour or when it drops to 0 Hit Points. The spirits look like living, breathing warriors, and they have Immunity to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Frightened apply=false] conditions. Once you use the horn, it can't be used again until 7 days have passed.

If you blow the horn without meeting its requirement, the summoned spirits attack you. If you meet the requirement, they are Friendly to you and your allies and follow your commands.

Horn of Valhalla: Condition Immunity.name: Horn of Valhalla: Condition Immunity
Horn of Valhalla: Condition Immunity.description: The spirits look like living, breathing warriors, and they have Immunity to the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] and &Reference[Frightened apply=false] conditions.

Brooch of Shielding.name: Brooch of Shielding
Brooch of Shielding.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this brooch, you have Resistance to Force damage, and you have Immunity to damage from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile} spell.

Resistance: Force.name: Resistance: Force
Resistance: Force.description: Additionally, you have Immunity to damage from the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile} spell.

Broom of Flying.name: Broom of Flying
Broom of Flying.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

This wooden broom functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and take a Magic action to make it hover beneath you, at which time it can be ridden in the air. It has a Fly Speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 pounds, but its Fly Speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land or when you're no longer riding it.

As a Magic action, you can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you name the location and are familiar with it. The broom comes back to you when you take a Magic action and use a command word if the broom is still within 1 mile of you.

Riding Broom (Low Weight).name: Riding Broom (Low Weight)
Riding Broom (Low Weight).description: The broom can carry up to 400 pounds, but its Fly Speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds.

Riding Broom (High Weight).name: Riding Broom (High Weight)
Riding Broom (High Weight).description: The broom can carry up to 400 pounds, but its Fly Speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds.

Bucket.name: Bucket
Bucket.description: A Bucket holds up to half a cubic foot of contents.

Bullets, Firearm.name: Bullets, Firearm
Bullets, Firearm.description:
Storage: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPouch000000]{Pouch}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAmmunitionV]{Ammunition} is required by a weapon that has the Ammunition property. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon. The Ammunition table lists the different types and the amount you get when you buy them. The table also lists the item that is typically used to store each type; storage must be bought separately.

Bullets, Sling.name: Bullets, Sling
Bullets, Sling.description:
Storage: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPouch000000]{Pouch}

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagAmmunitionV]{Ammunition} is required by a weapon that has the Ammunition property. A weapon's description specifies the type of ammunition used by the weapon. The Ammunition table lists the different types and the amount you get when you buy them. The table also lists the item that is typically used to store each type; storage must be bought separately.

Bullseye Lantern.name: Bullseye Lantern
Bullseye Lantern.description: A bullseye lantern casts bright light in a 60-foot cone and dim light for an additional 60 feet. Once lit, it burns for 6 hours on a flask (1 pint) of oil.

Burglar's Pack.name: Burglar's Pack
Burglar's Pack.description: A Burglar's Pack contains the following items: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBackpack000]{Backpack}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBallBearing]{Ball Bearings}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBell0000000]{Bell}, 10 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCandle00000]{Candles}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagCrowbar0000]{Crowbar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.wjHtGnd05SPdURqE]{Hooded Lantern}, 7 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagOil00000000]{flasks of Oil}, 5 days of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRations0000]{Rations}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRope0000000]{Rope}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagTinderbox00]{Tinderbox}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagWaterskin00]{Waterskin}.

Burnt Othur Fumes.name: Burnt Othur Fumes
Burnt Othur Fumes.description:
Inhaled Poison

A creature subjected to Burnt Othur Fumes must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) Poison damage, and it must repeat the save at the start of each of its turns. On each successive failed save, the creature takes 3 (1d6) Poison damage. After three successful saves, the poison ends.

Calligrapher's Supplies.name: Calligrapher's Supplies
Calligrapher's Supplies.description:
Ability: Dexterity

Utilize: Write text with impressive flourishes that guard against forgery (DC 15)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagInk00000000]{Ink}, Spell Scroll

Caltrops.name: Caltrops
Caltrops.description: As a Utilize action, you can spread Caltrops from their bag to cover a 5-foot-square area within 5 feet of yourself. A creature that enters this area for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 1 Piercing damage and have its Speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn. It takes 10 minutes to recover the Caltrops.

Candle.name: Candle
Candle.description: For 1 hour, a lit Candle sheds Bright Light in a 5-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 5 feet.

Candle of Invocation.name: Candle of Invocation
Candle of Invocation.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

This candle's magic is activated when the candle is lit, which requires a Magic action. After burning for 4 hours, the candle is destroyed. You can snuff it out early for use at a later time. Deduct the time it burned in increments of 1 minute from its total burn time.

While lit, the candle sheds Dim Light in a 30-foot radius. While you are within that light, you have Advantage on D20 Tests. In addition, a Cleric or Druid in the light can cast level 1 spells they have prepared without expending spell slots.

Alternatively, when you light the candle for the first time, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGate000000]{Gate} with it. Doing so destroys the candle. The portal created by the spell links to a particular Outer Plane chosen by the GM or determined by rolling on the following table.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgCandleOfInvoc rollable]

Lit Candle of Invocation.name: Lit Candle of Invocation
Lit Candle of Invocation.description: While lit, the candle sheds Dim Light in a 30-foot radius. While you are within that light, you have Advantage on D20 Tests. In addition, a Cleric or Druid in the light can cast level 1 spells they have prepared without expending spell slots.

Cape of the Mountebank.name: Cape of the Mountebank
Cape of the Mountebank.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

This cape smells faintly of brimstone. While wearing it, you can use it to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDimensionD]{Dimension Door} as a Magic action. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

When you teleport with that spell, you leave behind a cloud of smoke. The space you left is &Reference[LightlyObscured] by that smoke until the end of your next turn.

qsuojT0nn8ZkAY19.chatFlavor: The space you left is &Reference[LightlyObscured] by smoke until the end of your next turn.

Carpenter's Tools.name: Carpenter's Tools
Carpenter's Tools.description:
Ability: Strength

Utilize: Seal or pry open a door or container (DC 20)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepClub000000]{Club}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatclub0]{Greatclub}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepQuartersta]{Quarterstaff}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBarrel00000]{Barrel}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagChest000000]{Chest}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagLadder00000]{Ladder}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPole0000000]{Pole}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.srTRzwTfWKO5opOo]{Portable Ram}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagTorch000000]{Torch}

Carpet of Flying.name: Carpet of Flying
Carpet of Flying.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare

You can make this carpet hover and fly by taking a Magic action and using the carpet's command word. It moves according to your directions if you are within 30 feet of it.

Four sizes of Carpet of Flying exist. The GM chooses the size of a given carpet or determines it randomly by rolling on the following table. A carpet can carry up to twice the weight shown on the table, but its Fly Speed is halved if it carries more than its normal capacity.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgCarpetOfFlyin rollable]

Foundry Note

The four provided summoning activities represent the possible sizes of the carpet. When the GM chooses a size, the three activities corresponding to the other sizes should be deleted.

Cartographer's Tools.name: Cartographer's Tools
Cartographer's Tools.description:
Ability: Wisdom

Utilize: Draft a map of a small area (DC 15)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagMap00000000]{Map}

Case, Crossbow Bolt.name: Case, Crossbow Bolt
Case, Crossbow Bolt.description: A Crossbow Bolt Case holds up to 20 Bolts.

Case, Map or Scroll.name: Case, Map or Scroll
Case, Map or Scroll.description: A Map or Scroll Case holds up to 10 sheets of paper or 5 sheets of parchment.

Censer of Controlling Air Elementals.name: Censer of Controlling Air Elementals
Censer of Controlling Air Elementals.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

While gently swinging this censer, you can take a Magic action to summon an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmAirElemental00]{Air Elemental}. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space as close to the censer as possible, understands your languages, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your Initiative count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a Bonus Action. The censer can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Chain.name: Chain
Chain.description: As a Utilize action, you can wrap a Chain around an unwilling creature within 5 feet of yourself that has the &Reference[Grappled], &Reference[Incapacitated], or &Reference[Restrained] condition if you succeed on a DC 13 Strength (Athletics) check. If the creature's legs are bound, the creature has the Restrained condition until it escapes. Escaping the Chain requires the creature to make a successful DC 18 Dexterity (Acrobatics) check as an action. Bursting the Chain requires a successful DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action.

Chest.name: Chest
Chest.description: A Chest holds up to 12 cubic feet of contents.

Chime of Opening.name: Chime of Opening
Chime of Opening.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

This hollow metal tube measures about 1 foot long and weighs 1 pound. As a Magic action, you can strike the chime to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplKnock00000]{Knock}. The spell's customary knocking sound is replaced by the clear, ringing tone of the chime, which is audible out to 300 feet.

The chime can be used 10 times. After the tenth time, it cracks and becomes useless.

Circlet of Blasting.name: Circlet of Blasting
Circlet of Blasting.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

While wearing this circlet, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScorchingR]{Scorching Ray} with it (+5 to hit). The circlet can't cast this spell again until the next dawn.

Clawed Gauntlet.name: Clawed Gauntlet
Clawed Gauntlet.description:
See: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgDemonArmor000]

The armor's clawed gauntlets allow your Unarmed Strikes to deal 1d8 Slashing damage instead of the usual Bludgeoning damage, and you gain a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes.

Climber's Kit.name: Climber's Kit
Climber's Kit.description: A Climber's Kit includes boot tips, gloves, pitons, and a harness. As a Utilize action, you can use the Climber's Kit to anchor yourself; when you do, you can't fall more than 25 feet from the anchor point, and you can't move more than 25 feet from there without undoing the anchor as a Bonus Action.

Cloak of Arachnida.name: Cloak of Arachnida
Cloak of Arachnida.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

This fine garment is made of black silk interwoven with faint, silvery threads. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits.

Poison Resistance. You have Resistance to Poison damage.

Spider Climb. You have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed and can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

Spider Walk. You can't be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were Difficult Terrain.

Web. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWeb0000000]{Web} (save DC 13). The web created by the spell fills twice its normal area. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Spider Movement and Resistance.name: Spider Movement and Resistance
Spider Movement and Resistance.description:
Poison Resistance. You have Resistance to Poison damage.

Spider Climb. You have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed and can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

Spider Walk. You can’t be caught in webs of any sort and can move through webs as if they were Difficult Terrain.

Cloak of Displacement.name: Cloak of Displacement
Cloak of Displacement.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

While you wear this cloak, it magically projects an illusion that makes you appear to be standing in a place near your actual location, causing any creature to have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you. If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while your Speed is 0.

Foundry Note

The Displacement Suppressed effect is optionally provided to toggle as an indicator of the cloak's temporarily ceased functionality.

Displacement Suppressed.name: Displacement Suppressed
Displacement Suppressed.description: If you take damage, the property ceases to function until the start of your next turn. This property is suppressed while your Speed is 0.

Cloak of Elvenkind.name: Cloak of Elvenkind
Cloak of Elvenkind.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While you wear this cloak, Wisdom (Perception) checks made to perceive you have Disadvantage, and you have Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks.

Cloak of Invisibility.name: Cloak of Invisibility
Cloak of Invisibility.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary (Requires Attunement)

This cloak has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn . While wearing the cloak, you can take a Magic action to pull its hood over your head and expend 1 charge to give yourself the &Reference[Invisible apply=false] condition for 1 hour. The effect ends early if you pull the hood down (no action required) or cease wearing the cloak.

Hood Up: Invisible.name: Hood Up: Invisible
Hood Up: Invisible.description: The effect ends early if you pull the hood down (no action required) or cease wearing the cloak.

Cloak of Protection.name: Cloak of Protection
Cloak of Protection.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class and saving throws while you wear this cloak.

Cloak of the Bat.name: Cloak of the Bat
Cloak of the Bat.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this cloak, you have Advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. In an area of Dim Light or Darkness, you can grip the edges of the cloak and use it to gain a Fly Speed of 40 feet. If you ever fail to grip the cloak's edges while flying in this way, or if you are no longer in &Reference[DimLight] or &Reference[Darkness], you lose this Fly Speed.

While wearing the cloak in an area of Dim Light or Darkness, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph} on yourself, shape-shifting into a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmBat00000000000]{Bat}. While in that form, you retain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. The cloak can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Grip Edges.name: Grip Edges
Grip Edges.condition: in an area of Dim Light or Darkness

baY1WKtwieimGXWd.condition: in an area of Dim Light or Darkness

Cloak of the Manta Ray.name: Cloak of the Manta Ray
Cloak of the Manta Ray.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this cloak, you can breathe underwater, and you have a Swim Speed of 60 feet.

Aquatic Bonuses: Swimming and Breathing.name: Aquatic Bonuses: Swimming and Breathing
Aquatic Bonuses: Swimming and Breathing.description: You can breathe underwater, and you have a Swim Speed of 60 feet.

Clothes, Fine.name: Clothes, Fine
Clothes, Fine.description: Fine Clothes are made of expensive fabrics and adorned with expertly crafted details. Some events and locations admit only people wearing these clothes.

Clothes, Traveler's.name: Clothes, Traveler's
Clothes, Traveler's.description: Traveler's Clothes are resilient garments designed for travel in various environments.

Cobbler's Tools.name: Cobbler's Tools
Cobbler's Tools.description:
Ability: Dexterity

Utilize: Modify footwear to give Advantage on the wearer's next Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (DC 10)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagClimbersKit]{Climber's Kit}

Collapsing Roof.name: Collapsing Roof
Collapsing Roof.description:
Deadly Trap (Levels 1–4)

Trigger: A creature crosses a trip wire

Duration: Instantaneous

This trap uses a trip wire to collapse an unstable section of ceiling. The trip wire is 3 inches off the ground and stretches between two weak supports that topple when the trip wire is pulled.

The first creature that crosses the trip wire causes the supports to topple and the unstable section of ceiling to collapse. Each creature beneath the unstable section of ceiling must succeed on a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 11 (2d10) Bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. Rubble from the collapse turns the trapped area into &Reference[Difficult Terrain].

Detect and Disarm. As a Search action, a creature can examine the trapped area and make a [[/check prc 11]] check, detecting the trip wire and the unstable section of ceiling on a successful check. Once detected, the trip wire can be easily cut or avoided (no ability check required).

At Higher Levels. You can scale the trap for higher levels by increasing the damage and the save DC, as shown in the following table.

Levels

Bludgeoning Damage

Save DC

5–10

22 (4d10)

15

11–16

55 (10d10)

17

17–20

99 (18d10)

19

Comet.name: Comet
Comet.description: The next time you enter combat against one or more Hostile creatures, you can select one of them as your foe when you roll Initiative. If you reduce your foe to 0 Hit Points during that combat, you have Advantage on Death Saving Throws for 1 year. If someone else reduces your chosen foe to 0 Hit Points or you don't choose a foe, this card has no effect.

Card Effect: Start.name: Card Effect: Start
Card Effect: Start.condition: The next time you enter combat against one or more Hostile creatures

Card Effect: Resolve.name: Card Effect: Resolve
Card Effect: Resolve.condition: when the selected Hostile creature dies during this combat

Comet Card: Marked Foe.name: Comet Card: Marked Foe
Comet Card: Marked Foe.description: If you reduce your foe to 0 Hit Points during that combat, you have Advantage on Death Saving Throws for 1 year.

Comet Card: Death Save Advantage.name: Comet Card: Death Save Advantage
Comet Card: Death Save Advantage.description:
Source: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgDmtComet00000]{Comet}

You have Advantage on Death Saving Throws for 1 year.

Component Pouch.name: Component Pouch
Component Pouch.description: A Component Pouch is watertight and filled with compartments that hold all the free Material components of your spells.

Cook's Utensils.name: Cook's Utensils
Cook's Utensils.description:
Ability: Wisdom

Utilize: Improve food's flavor (DC 10), or detect spoiled or poisoned food (DC 15)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRations0000]{Rations}

Costume.name: Costume
Costume.description: While wearing a Costume, you have Advantage on any ability check you make to impersonate the person or type of person it represents.

Crawler Mucus.name: Crawler Mucus
Crawler Mucus.description:
Contact Poison

A creature subjected to Carrion Crawler Mucus must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 minute. The creature also has the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition while Poisoned in this way. The creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Crowbar.name: Crowbar
Crowbar.description: Using a Crowbar gives you Advantage on Strength checks where the Crowbar's leverage can be applied.

Crystal.name: Crystal
Crystal.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Crystal Ball.name: Crystal Ball
Crystal Ball.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

While touching this crystal orb, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying} (save DC 17) with it.

Crystal Ball of Mind Reading.name: Crystal Ball of Mind Reading
Crystal Ball of Mind Reading.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary (Requires Attunement)

While touching this crystal orb, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying} (save DC 17) with it. In addition, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectThou]{Detect Thoughts} (save DC 17) targeting creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You don't need to concentrate on this Detect Thoughts spell to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if the Scrying spell ends.

Crystal Ball of Telepathy.name: Crystal Ball of Telepathy
Crystal Ball of Telepathy.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary (Requires Attunement)

While touching this crystal orb, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying} (save DC 17) with it. In addition, you can communicate telepathically with creatures you can see within 30 feet of the spell's sensor. You can also cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSuggestion]{Suggestion} (save DC 17) through the sensor on one of those creatures. You don't need to concentrate on this Suggestion to maintain it during its duration, but it ends if Scrying ends. You can't cast Suggestion in this way again until the next dawn.

Crystal Ball of True Seeing.name: Crystal Ball of True Seeing
Crystal Ball of True Seeing.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary (Requires Attunement)

While touching this crystal orb, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying} (save DC 17) with it. In addition, you have Truesight with a range of 120 feet centered on the spell's sensor.

Cube of Force.name: Cube of Force
Cube of Force.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This cube is about an inch across. Each face has a distinct marking on it. You can press one of those faces, expend the number of charges required for it, and thereby cast the spell associated with it (save DC 17), as shown in the Cube of Force Faces table.

The cube starts with 10 charges, and it regains 1d6 expended charges daily at dawn.

Cube of Force Faces
SpellCharge Cost
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMageArmor0]{Mage Armor}1
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplShield0000]{Shield}1
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLeomundsTi]{Tiny Hut}3

Cubic Gate.name: Cubic Gate
Cubic Gate.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary

This cube is 3 inches across and radiates palpable magical energy. The six sides of the cube are each keyed to a different plane of existence, one of which is the Material Plane. The other sides are linked to planes determined by the DM.

The cube has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. As a Magic action, you can expend 1 of the cube's charges to cast one of the following spells using the cube.

Gate. Pressing one side of the cube, you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGate000000]{Gate}, opening a portal to the plane of existence keyed to that side.

Plane Shift. Pressing one side of the cube twice, you cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPlaneShift]{Plane Shift}, transporting the targets to the plane of existence keyed to that side.

Dagger of Venom.name: Dagger of Venom
Dagger of Venom.description:
Weapon (Dagger), Rare

You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

You can take a Bonus Action to magically coat the blade with poison. The poison remains for 1 minute or until an attack using this weapon hits a creature. That creature must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 2d10 Poison damage and have the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 minute. The weapon can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Poisoned.name: Poisoned
Poisoned.description: The creature has the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 minute.

Dancing Sword.name: Dancing Sword
Dancing Sword.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatsword]{Greatsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongsword0]{Longsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepRapier0000]{Rapier}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepScimitar00]{Scimitar}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepShortsword]{Shortsword}), Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

You can take a Bonus Action to toss this magic weapon into the air. When you do so, the weapon begins to hover, flies up to 30 feet, and attacks one creature of your choice within 5 feet of itself. The weapon uses your attack roll and adds your ability modifier to damage rolls.

While the weapon hovers, you can take a Bonus Action to cause it to fly up to 30 feet to another spot within 30 feet of you. As part of the same Bonus Action, you can cause the weapon to attack one creature within 5 feet of the weapon.

After the hovering weapon attacks for the fourth time, it flies back to you and tries to return to your hand. If you have no hand free, the weapon falls to the ground in your space. If the weapon has no unobstructed path to you, it moves as close to you as it can and then falls to the ground. It also ceases to hover if you grasp it or are more than 30 feet away from it.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Decanter of Endless Water.name: Decanter of Endless Water
Decanter of Endless Water.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

This stoppered flask sloshes when shaken, as if it contains water. The decanter weighs 2 pounds.

You can take a Magic action to remove the stopper and issue one of three command words, whereupon an amount of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgspWaterfresh0]{fresh water} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgspWatersalt00]{salt water} (your choice) pours out of the flask. The water stops pouring out at the start of your next turn. Choose from the following command words:

Splash. The decanter produces 1 gallon of water.

Fountain. The decanter produces 5 gallons of water.

Geyser. The decanter produces 30 gallons of water that gushes forth in a Line 30 feet long and 1 foot wide. If you're holding the decanter, you can aim the geyser in one direction (no action required). One creature of your choice in the Line must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or take 1d4 Bludgeoning damage and have the &Reference[Prone] condition. Instead of a creature, you can target one object in the Line that isn't being worn or carried and that weighs no more than 200 pounds. The object is knocked over by the geyser.

Deck of Illusions.name: Deck of Illusions
Deck of Illusions.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

This box contains a set of cards. A full deck has 34 cards: 32 depicting specific creatures and two with a mirrored surface. A deck found as treasure is usually missing [[/r 1d20 − 1#Missing cards]] cards.

The magic of the deck functions only if its cards are drawn at random. You can take a Magic action to draw a card at random from the deck and throw it to the ground at a point within 30 feet of yourself. An illusion of a creature, determined by rolling on the Deck of Illusions table, forms over the thrown card and remains until dispelled. The illusory creature created by the card looks and behaves like a real creature of its kind, except that it can do no harm. While you are within 120 feet of the illusory creature and can see it, you can take a Magic action to move it anywhere within 30 feet of its card.

Any physical interaction with the illusory creature reveals it to be false, because objects pass through it. A creature that takes a Study action to visually inspect the illusory creature identifies it as an illusion with a successful [[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=15 format=long]]. The illusion lasts until its card is moved or the illusion is dispelled (using a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDispelMagi]{Dispel Magic} spell or a similar effect). When the illusion ends, the image on its card disappears, and that card can't be used again.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgDeckOfIllusio rollable]

Foundry Note

Due to the single-use nature of each card, it is recommended to import a copy of the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgDeckOfIllusio]{table} and insert its UUID into the @Embed enricher, above.

Additionally, when first obtained, the GM or player should use the Count Number of Cards activity to randomly determine the total number of cards remaining in the deck. After one use, it may be deleted.

Count Number of Cards.name: Count Number of Cards
Count Number of Cards.chatFlavor: You find the deck missing some cards.

Defender.name: Defender
Defender.description:
Weapon (Any Melee Weapon), Legendary (Requires Attunement)

You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The first time you attack with the weapon on each of your turns, you can transfer some or all of the weapon's bonus to your Armor Class. For example, you could reduce the bonus to your attack rolls and damage rolls to +1 and gain a +2 bonus to Armor Class. The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the weapon to gain a bonus to AC from it.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Transferred AC Bonus: 1.name: Transferred AC Bonus: 1
Transferred AC Bonus: 1.description: The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the weapon to gain a bonus to AC from it.

Transferred AC Bonus: 2.name: Transferred AC Bonus: 2
Transferred AC Bonus: 2.description: The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the weapon to gain a bonus to AC from it.

Transferred AC Bonus: 3.name: Transferred AC Bonus: 3
Transferred AC Bonus: 3.description: The adjusted bonuses remain in effect until the start of your next turn, although you must hold the weapon to gain a bonus to AC from it.

Demon Armor.name: Demon Armor
Demon Armor.description:
Armor (Any Light, Medium, or Heavy), Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class, and you know Abyssal. In addition, the armor's clawed gauntlets allow your Unarmed Strikes to deal 1d8 Slashing damage instead of the usual Bludgeoning damage, and you gain a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls of your Unarmed Strikes.

Curse. Once you don this cursed armor, you can't doff it unless you are targeted by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic. While wearing the armor, you have Disadvantage on attack rolls against demons and on saving throws against their spells and special abilities.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Dice.name: Dice
Dice.description:
Ability: Wisdom

Utilize: Discern whether someone is cheating (DC 10), or win the game (DC 20)

Dimensional Shackles.name: Dimensional Shackles
Dimensional Shackles.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

You can take a Utilize action to place these shackles on a creature that has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition. The shackles adjust to fit a creature of Small to Large size. The shackles prevent a creature bound by them from using any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence. They don't prevent the creature from passing through an interdimensional portal.

You and any creature you designate when you use the shackles can take a Utilize action to remove them. Once every 30 days, the bound creature can make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=30 format=long]]. On a successful check, the creature breaks free and destroys the shackles.

Attempt Escape.name: Attempt Escape
Attempt Escape.chatFlavor: Can be attempted once every 30 days

Dimensionally Bound.name: Dimensionally Bound
Dimensionally Bound.description:
The shackles prevent a creature bound by them from using any method of extradimensional movement, including teleportation or travel to a different plane of existence. They don’t prevent the creature from passing through an interdimensional portal.

Once every 30 days, the bound creature can make a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=30 format=long]]. On a successful check, the creature breaks free and destroys the shackles.

Diplomat's Pack.name: Diplomat's Pack
Diplomat's Pack.description: A Diplomat's Pack contains the following items: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagChest000000]{Chest}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.FqFmdzIBUSxFKKfi]{Fine Clothes}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagInk00000000]{Ink}, 5 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagInkPen00000]{Ink Pens}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagLamp0000000]{Lamp}, 2 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.5mIeX824uMklU3xq]{Map or Scroll Cases}, 4 @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagOil00000000]{flasks of Oil}, 5 sheets of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPaper000000]{Paper}, 5 sheets of @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagParchment00]{Parchment}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagPerfume0000]{Perfume}, and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagTinderbox00]{Tinderbox}.

Donjon.name: Donjon
Donjon.description: You disappear and become entombed in a state of suspended animation in an extradimensional sphere. Everything you're wearing and carrying disappears with you except for Artifacts, which stay behind in the space you occupied when you disappeared. You remain imprisoned until you are found and removed from the sphere. You can't be located by any Divination magic, but a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell can reveal the location of your prison. You draw no more cards.

Card Effect.name: Card Effect
Card Effect.condition: Card's effect occurs immediately upon draw

Donjon Card: Suspended Animation.name: Donjon Card: Suspended Animation
Donjon Card: Suspended Animation.description:
Source: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgDmtDonjon0000]{Donjon}

You remain imprisoned until you are found and removed from the sphere. You can’t be located by any Divination magic, but a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell can reveal the location of your prison.

Dragon Orb.name: Dragon Orb
Dragon Orb.description:
Wondrous Item, Artifact (Requires Attunement)

While attuned to an orb, you can take a Magic action to peer into the orb's depths. You must then make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, you control the orb for as long as you remain attuned to it. On a failed save, the orb imposes the Charmed condition on you for as long as you remain attuned to it.

While you are Charmed by the orb, you can't voluntarily end your Attunement to it, and the orb casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplSuggestion]{Suggestion} on you at will (save DC 18), urging you to work toward the evil ends it desires. The dragon essence within the orb might want many things: the annihilation of a particular society or organization, freedom from the orb, to spread suffering in the world, to advance the worship of Tiamat, or something else the GM decides.

Destroying an Orb. An Dragon Orb has AC 20 and is destroyed if it takes damage from a +3 Weapon or a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisintegra]{Disintegrate} spell. Nothing else can harm it.

An orb is an etched crystal globe about 10 inches in diameter. When used, it grows to about 20 inches in diameter, and mist swirls inside it.

Spells. The orb has 7 charges and regains 1d4 + 3 expended charges daily at dawn. If you control the orb, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell.

Spell

Charge Cost

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCureWounds]{Cure Wounds} (level 9 version)

4

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDaylight00]{Daylight}

1

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDeathWard0]{Death Ward}

2

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic}

0

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplScrying000]{Scrying} (save DC 18)

3

Call Dragons. While you control the orb, you can take a Magic action to cause the orb to issue a telepathic call that extends in all directions for 40 miles. Chromatic dragons in range feel compelled to come to the orb as soon as possible by the most direct route. Dragon deities such as Tiamat are unaffected by this call. Chromatic dragons drawn to the orb might be Hostile toward you for compelling them against their will. Once you have used this property, it can't be used again for 1 hour.

Dragon Scale Mail.name: Dragon Scale Mail
Dragon Scale Mail.description:
Armor (Scale Mail), Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

Dragon Scale Mail is made of the scales of one kind of dragon. Sometimes dragons collect their cast-off scales and gift them. Other times, hunters carefully preserve the hide of a dead dragon. In either case, Dragon Scale Mail is highly valued.

While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class, you have Advantage on saving throws against the breath weapons of Dragons, and you have Resistance to one damage type determined by the kind of dragon that provided the scales (see the accompanying table).

Additionally, you can focus your senses as a Magic action to discern the distance and direction to the closest dragon within 30 miles of yourself that is of the same type as the armor. This action can't be used again until the next dawn.

Resistance Table

Dragon

Resistance

Black

Acid

Gold

Fire

Blue

Lightning

Green

Poison

Brass

Fire

Red

Fire

Bronze

Lightning

Silver

Cold

Copper

Acid

White

Cold

Foundry Note

The Select Dragon Type activity can be used to select the type of dragon for this armor. It includes the +1 bonus and an Active Effect that provides the Resistance.

Dragon Slayer.name: Dragon Slayer
Dragon Slayer.description:
Weapon (Any Simple or Martial), Rare

You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

The weapon deals an extra 3d6 damage of the weapon's type if the target is a Dragon.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]
