Regaining Charges. The staff regains 4d6 + 2 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 20, the staff regains [[/r 1d12 + 1]] charges.

Retributive Strike. You can take a Magic action to break the staff over your knee or against a solid surface. The staff is destroyed and releases its magic in an explosion that fills a 30-foot Emanation originating from itself. You have a 50 percent chance to instantly travel to a random plane of existence, avoiding the explosion ([[/r 1d2]], teleported on a 1). If you fail to avoid the effect, you take Force damage equal to 16 times the number of charges in the staff. Each other creature in the area makes a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Force damage equal to 6 times the number of charges in the staff. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

Foundry Note

The Spell Absorption activity allows you to select the level of the cast spell and restores that number of charges.

Staff of the Python.name: Staff of the Python
Staff of the Python.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcStaffalsoa]{Staff}, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

As a Magic action, you can throw this staff so that it lands in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of you, causing the staff to become a Giant Constrictor Snake in that space. The snake is under your control and shares your Initiative count, taking its turn immediately after yours.

On your turn, you can mentally command the snake (no action required) if it is within 60 feet of you and you don't have the Incapacitated condition. You decide what action the snake takes and where it moves during its turn, or you can issue it a general command, such as to attack your enemies or guard a location. Absent commands from you, the snake defends itself.

As a Bonus Action, you can command the snake to revert to staff form in its current space, and you can't use the staff's property again for 1 hour. If the snake is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it dies and reverts to its staff form; the staff then shatters and is destroyed. If the snake reverts to staff form before losing all its Hit Points, it regains all of them.

Staff of the Woodlands.name: Staff of the Woodlands
Staff of the Woodlands.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcStaffalsoa]{Staff}, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Druid)

This staff has 6 charges and can be wielded as a magic Quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you have a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls.

Spells. While holding the staff, you can cast one of the spells on the following table from it, using your spell save DC. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell.

Spell

Charge Cost

Animal Friendship

1

Awaken

5

Barkskin

2

Locate Animals or Plants

2

Pass without Trace

2

Speak with Animals

1

Speak with Plants

3

Wall of Thorns

6

Tree Form. You can take a Magic action to plant one end of the staff in earth in an unoccupied space and expend 1 charge to transform the staff into a healthy tree. The tree is 60 feet tall and has a 5-foot-diameter trunk, and its branches at the top spread out in a 20-foot radius. The tree appears ordinary but radiates a faint aura of Transmutation magic that can be discerned with the Detect Magic spell. While touching the tree and using a Magic action, you return the staff to its normal form. Any creature in the tree falls when the tree reverts to a staff.

Regaining Charges. The staff regains 1d6 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the staff loses its properties and becomes a nonmagical Quarterstaff.

Star.name: Star
Star.description: Increase one of your ability scores by 2, to a maximum of 24.

Card Effect.name: Card Effect
Card Effect.condition: Card's effect occurs immediately upon draw

Stone of Controlling Earth Elementals.name: Stone of Controlling Earth Elementals
Stone of Controlling Earth Elementals.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare

While touching this 5-pound stone to the ground, you can take a Magic action to summon an @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmEarthElemental]{Earth Elemental}. The elemental appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 30 feet of yourself, obeys your commands, and takes its turn immediately after you on your Initiative count. The elemental disappears after 1 hour, when it dies, or when you dismiss it as a Bonus Action. The stone can't be used this way again until the next dawn.

Stone of Good Luck (Luckstone).name: Stone of Good Luck (Luckstone)
Stone of Good Luck (Luckstone).description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

While this polished agate is on your person, you gain a +1 bonus to ability checks and saving throws.

Foundry Note

This item includes an Active Effect that automates the bonus.

String.name: String
String.description: String is 10 feet long. You can tie a knot in it as a Utilize action.

Sun.name: Sun
Sun.description: A magic item (chosen by the DM) appears on your person. In addition, you gain 10 Temporary Hit Points daily at dawn until you die.

Card Effect.name: Card Effect
Card Effect.condition: Card's effect occurs immediately upon draw

Sun Card: Daily Temp HP.name: Sun Card: Daily Temp HP
Sun Card: Daily Temp HP.description:
Source: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgDmtSun0000000]{Sun}

You gain [[/healing 10 type=temphp]]{10 Temporary Hit Points} daily at dawn until you die.

Sun Blade.name: Sun Blade
Sun Blade.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongsword0]{Longsword}), Rare (Requires Attunement)

This item appears to be a sword hilt.

Blade of Radiance. While grasping the hilt, you can take a Bonus Action to cause a blade of pure radiance to spring into existence or make the blade disappear. While the blade exists, this magic weapon functions as a Longsword with the Finesse property. If you are proficient with Longswords or Shortswords, you are proficient with the Sun Blade.

You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this weapon, which deals Radiant damage instead of Slashing damage. When you hit an Undead with it, that target takes an extra 1d8 Radiant damage.

Sunlight. The sword's luminous blade emits Bright Light in a 15-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 15 feet. The light is sunlight. While the blade persists, you can take a Magic action to expand or reduce its radius of Bright Light and Dim Light by 5 feet each, to a maximum of 30 feet each or a minimum of 10 feet each.

Foundry Note

If you are proficient with Shortswords you can manually set the item as proficient.

Sword of Life Stealing.name: Sword of Life Stealing
Sword of Life Stealing.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGlaive0000]{Glaive}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatsword]{Greatsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongsword0]{Longsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepRapier0000]{Rapier}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepScimitar00]{Scimitar}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepShortsword]{Shortsword}), Rare (Requires Attunement)

When you attack a creature with this magic weapon and roll a 20 on the d20 for the attack roll, that target takes an extra 15 Necrotic damage if it isn't a Construct or an Undead, and you gain Temporary Hit Points equal to the amount of Necrotic damage taken.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Sword of Sharpness.name: Sword of Sharpness
Sword of Sharpness.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGlaive0000]{Glaive}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatsword]{Greatsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongsword0]{Longsword}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepScimitar00]{Scimitar}), Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

When you attack an object with this magic weapon and hit, maximize your weapon damage dice against the target.

When you attack a creature with this weapon and roll a 20 on the d20 for the attack roll, that target takes an extra 14 Slashing damage and gains 1 &Reference[Exhaustion] level.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Sword of Wounding.name: Sword of Wounding
Sword of Wounding.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGlaive0000]{Glaive}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatsword]{Greatsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongsword0]{Longsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepRapier0000]{Rapier}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepScimitar00]{Scimitar}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepShortsword]{Shortsword}), Rare (Requires Attunement)

When you hit a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target takes an extra 2d6 Necrotic damage and must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be unable to regain Hit Points for 1 hour. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Talisman of Pure Good.name: Talisman of Pure Good
Talisman of Pure Good.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary (Requires Attunement by a Cleric or Paladin)

This talisman is a mighty symbol of goodness. A Fiend or an Undead that touches the talisman takes 8d6 Radiant damage and takes the damage again each time it ends its turn holding or carrying the talisman.

Holy Symbol. You can use the talisman as a Holy Symbol. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while you wear or hold it.

Pure Rebuke. The talisman has 7 charges. While wearing or holding the talisman, you can take a Magic action to expend 1 charge and target one creature you can see on the ground within 120 feet of yourself. A flaming fissure opens under the target, and the target makes a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. If the target is a Fiend or an Undead, it has Disadvantage on the save. On a failed save, the target falls into the fissure and is destroyed, leaving no remains. On a successful save, the target isn't cast into the fissure but takes 4d6 Psychic damage from the ordeal. In either case, the fissure then closes, leaving no trace of its existence. When you expend the last charge, the talisman disperses into motes of golden light and is destroyed.

Talisman of Ultimate Evil.name: Talisman of Ultimate Evil
Talisman of Ultimate Evil.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary (Requires Attunement)

This item symbolizes unrepentant evil. A creature that isn't a Fiend or an Undead that touches the talisman takes 8d6 Necrotic damage and takes the damage again each time it ends its turn holding or carrying the talisman.

Holy Symbol. You can use the talisman as a Holy Symbol. You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls while you wear or hold it.

Ultimate End. The talisman has 6 charges. While wearing or holding the talisman, you can take a Magic action to expend 1 charge and target one creature you can see on the ground within 120 feet of yourself. A flaming fissure opens under the target, and the target makes a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw. If the target is a Celestial, it has Disadvantage on the save. On a failed save, the target falls into the fissure and is destroyed, leaving no remains. On a successful save, the target isn't cast into the fissure but takes 4d6 Psychic damage from the ordeal. In either case, the fissure then closes, leaving no trace of its existence. When you expend the last charge, the talisman dissolves into foul-smelling slime and is destroyed.

Talisman of the Sphere.name: Talisman of the Sphere
Talisman of the Sphere.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary (Requires Attunement)

While holding or wearing this talisman, you have Advantage on any [[/skill arc]] check you make to control a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgSphereOfAnnih]{Sphere of Annihilation}. In addition, when you start your turn in control of a Sphere of Annihilation, you can take a Magic action to move it 10 feet plus a number of additional feet equal to 10 times your Intelligence modifier. This movement doesn't have to be in a straight line.

Talons.name: Talons
Talons.description: Every magic item you wear or carry disintegrates. Artifacts in your possession vanish instead.

Card Effect.name: Card Effect
Card Effect.condition: Card's effect occurs immediately upon draw

Tan Bag of Tricks.name: Tan Bag of Tricks
Tan Bag of Tricks.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

This bag made from gray, rust, or tan cloth appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, fuzzy object.

You can take a Magic action to pull the fuzzy object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling on the table that corresponds to the bag's color. See @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.mmMonstersAtoZ00]{Monsters} for the creature's stat block. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

The creature is Friendly to you and your allies, and it acts immediately after you on your Initiative count. You can take a Bonus Action to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, such as attacking an enemy. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature.

Once three fuzzy objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgTanBagOfTrick rollable]

Pull and Throw.name: Pull and Throw
Pull and Throw.chatFlavor: Transformed creature determined by GM or table roll

Tent.name: Tent
Tent.description: A Tent sleeps up to two Small or Medium creatures.

Thieves' Tools.name: Thieves' Tools
Thieves' Tools.description:
Ability: Dexterity

Utilize: Pick a lock (DC 15), or disarm a trap (DC 15)

Three-dragon ante.name: Three-dragon ante
Three-dragon ante.description:
Ability: Wisdom

Utilize: Discern whether someone is cheating (DC 10), or win the game (DC 20)

Throne.name: Throne
Throne.description:
You gain proficiency and &Reference[Expertise] in your choice of History, Insight, Intimidation, or Persuasion. In addition, you gain rightful ownership of a small keep somewhere in the world. However, the keep is currently home to one or more monsters, which must be cleared out before you can claim the keep as yours.

Foundry Note

Unlike the other cards from the Deck, this item will not destroy itself upon use in order to serve as a symbol of ownership of the keep.

Card Effect.name: Card Effect
Card Effect.condition: Card's effect occurs immediately upon draw

Thunderous Greatclub.name: Thunderous Greatclub
Thunderous Greatclub.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatclub0]{Greatclub}), Very Rare (Requires Attunement)

While you are attuned to this magic weapon, your Strength is 20 unless your Strength is already equal to or greater than that score. The weapon deals an extra 1d8 Thunder damage to any creature it hits and an extra 3d8 Thunder damage to objects it hits that aren't being worn or carried.

The weapon has the following additional properties.

Clap of Thunder. As a Magic action, you can strike the weapon against a hard surface to create a loud clap of thunder audible out to 300 feet. You also create a 30-foot Cone of thunderous energy. Each creature in the Cone must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have the Prone condition. Nonmagical objects in the Cone that aren't being worn or carried take [[/damage 3d8 type=thunder]] damage.

Earthquake. As a Magic action, you can strike the weapon against the ground to create an intense seismic disturbance in a 50-foot-radius circle centered on the point of impact. Structures in contact with the ground in that area take 50 Bludgeoning damage, and each creature on the ground in that area must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw or have the Prone condition. If that creature is also concentrating, it must succeed on a [[/save con 20]] saving throw or its Concentration is broken. In addition, you can cause a 30-foot-deep, 10-foot-wide fissure to open up on the ground anywhere in the area. Any creature on a spot where the fissure opens must succeed on a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, falling into the fissure on a failed save or moving with the fissure's edge on a successful one. Any structure on a spot where the fissure opens collapses into the fissure. Once you use this property, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

attack.chatFlavor: Bonus Damage: 2d8 Thunder vs loose object

Tinderbox.name: Tinderbox
Tinderbox.description: A Tinderbox is a small container holding flint, fire steel, and tinder (usually dry cloth soaked in light oil) used to kindle a fire. Using it to light a Candle, Lamp, Lantern, or Torch—or anything else with exposed fuel—takes a Bonus Action. Lighting any other fire takes 1 minute.

Tinker's Tools.name: Tinker's Tools
Tinker's Tools.description:
Ability: Dexterity

Utilize: Assemble a Tiny item composed of scrap, which falls apart in 1 minute (DC 20)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepMusket0000]{Musket}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepPistol0000]{Pistol}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBell0000000]{Bell}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.UkWdyJYQTfVX2cJW]{Bullseye Lantern}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagFlask000000]{Flask}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.items.Item.wjHtGnd05SPdURqE]{Hooded Lantern}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagHuntingTrap]{Hunting Trap}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagLock0000000]{Lock}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagManacles000]{Manacles}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagMirror00000]{Mirror}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagShovel00000]{Shovel}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagSignalWhist]{Signal Whistle}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagTinderbox00]{Tinderbox}

Tome of Clear Thought.name: Tome of Clear Thought
Tome of Clear Thought.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare

This book contains memory and logic exercises, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Intelligence increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic but regains it in a century.

Foundry Note

This item includes 48 max uses for tracking hours read.

The Read activity includes a scaling value that lets you enter the amount of hours you've read. Once you hit 48 you can use the included Active Effect to increase your Intelligence.

The Reset Progress activity resets your uses to 0 if you fail to complete the book within 6 days and need to start over.

Tome of Leadership and Influence.name: Tome of Leadership and Influence
Tome of Leadership and Influence.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare

This book contains guidelines for influencing and charming others, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Charisma increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic but regains it in a century.

Foundry Note

This item includes 48 max uses for tracking hours read.

The Read activity includes a scaling value that lets you enter the amount of hours you've read. Once you hit 48 you can use the included Active Effect to increase your Charisma.

The Reset Progress activity resets your uses to 0 if you fail to complete the book within 6 days and need to start over.

Tome of Understanding.name: Tome of Understanding
Tome of Understanding.description:
Wondrous Item, Very Rare

This book contains intuition and insight exercises, and its words are charged with magic. If you spend 48 hours over a period of 6 days or fewer studying the book's contents and practicing its guidelines, your Wisdom increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. The manual then loses its magic, but regains it in a century.

Foundry Note

This item includes 48 max uses for tracking hours read.

The Read activity includes a scaling value that lets you enter the amount of hours you've read. Once you hit 48 you can use the included Active Effect to increase your Wisdom.

The Reset Progress activity resets your uses to 0 if you fail to complete the book within 6 days and need to start over.

Torch.name: Torch
Torch.description: A Torch burns for 1 hour, casting Bright Light in a 20-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 20 feet. When you take the Attack action, you can attack with the Torch, using it as a Simple Melee weapon. On a hit, the target takes 1 Fire damage.

Torpor.name: Torpor
Torpor.description:
Ingested Poison

A creature subjected to Torpor poison must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the &Reference[Poisoned] condition for [[/r 4d6]] hours. The creature's Speed is halved while the creature is Poisoned in this way.

Trident of Fish Command.name: Trident of Fish Command
Trident of Fish Command.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepTrident000]{Trident}), Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

This magic weapon has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While you carry it, you can expend 1 charge to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDominateBe]{Dominate Beast} (save DC 15) from it on a Beast that has a Swim Speed.

Truth Serum.name: Truth Serum
Truth Serum.description:
Ingested Poison

A creature subjected to Truth Serum must succeed on a DC 11 Constitution saving throw or have the &Reference[Poisoned] condition for 1 hour. The Poisoned creature can't knowingly communicate a lie.

Universal Solvent.name: Universal Solvent
Universal Solvent.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary

This tube holds milky liquid with a strong alcohol smell. When found, a tube contains 1d6 + 1 ounces.

You can take a Utilize action to pour 1 or more ounces of solvent from the tube onto a surface within reach. Each ounce instantly dissolves up to 1 square foot of adhesive it touches, including @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgSovereignGlue]{Sovereign Glue}.

Foundry Note

This item includes 7 limited uses. The Determine Ounces activity can be used to determine the number of ounces equivalent to 1d6 + 1.

The Apply Solvent activity allows you to select the number of ounces you're applying.

Vicious Weapon.name: Vicious Weapon
Vicious Weapon.description:
Weapon (Any Simple or Martial), Rare

This magic weapon deals an extra 2d6 damage to any creature it hits. This extra damage is of the same type as the weapon's normal damage.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Viol.name: Viol
Viol.description:
Ability: Charisma

Utilize: Play a known tune (DC 10), or improvise a song (DC 15)

Void.name: Void
Void.description: Your soul is drawn from your body and contained in an object in a place of the DM's choice. One or more powerful beings guard the place. While your soul is trapped in this way, your body is inert, ceases aging, and requires no food, air, or water. A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWish000000]{Wish} spell can't return your soul to your body, but the spell reveals the location of the object that holds your soul. You draw no more cards.

Card Effect.name: Card Effect
Card Effect.condition: Card's effect occurs immediately upon draw

Void Card: Contained Soul.name: Void Card: Contained Soul
Void Card: Contained Soul.description:
Source: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.dmgDmtVoid000000]{Void}

While your soul is trapped in this way, your body is inert, ceases aging, and requires no food, air, or water.

Vorpal Sword.name: Vorpal Sword
Vorpal Sword.description:
Weapon (@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGlaive0000]{Glaive}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatsword]{Greatsword}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepLongsword0]{Longsword}, or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepScimitar00]{Scimitar}), Legendary (Requires Attunement)

You gain a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. In addition, the weapon ignores Resistance to Slashing damage.

When you use this weapon to attack a creature that has at least one head and roll a 20 on the d20 for the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it has Immunity to Slashing damage, if it doesn't have or need a head, or if the GM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra 30 Slashing damage from the hit. If the creature has Legendary Resistance, it can expend one daily use of that trait to avoid losing its head, taking the extra damage instead.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Wand.name: Wand
Wand.description: An @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagArcaneFocus]{Arcane Focus} is bejeweled or carved to channel arcane magic. A Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard can use such an item as a Spellcasting Focus.

Wand of Binding.name: Wand of Binding
Wand of Binding.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This wand has 7 charges.

Wand of Enemy Detection.name: Wand of Enemy Detection
Wand of Enemy Detection.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can take a Magic action to expend 1 charge. For 1 minute, you know the direction of the nearest creature Hostile to you within 60 feet, but not its distance from you. The wand can sense the presence of Hostile creatures that are Invisible, ethereal, disguised, or hidden, as well as those in plain sight. The effect ends if you stop holding the wand.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Wand of Fear.description:

This wand has 7 charges.

Wand of Fireballs.name: Wand of Fireballs
Wand of Fireballs.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend no more than 3 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplFireball00]{Fireball} (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the level 3 version of the spell. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Wand of Lightning Bolts.name: Wand of Lightning Bolts
Wand of Lightning Bolts.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend no more than 3 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplLightningB]{Lightning Bolt} (save DC 15) from it. For 1 charge, you cast the level 3 version of the spell. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Wand of Magic Detection.name: Wand of Magic Detection
Wand of Magic Detection.description:
Wand, Uncommon

This wand has 3 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDetectMagi]{Detect Magic} from it. The wand regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn.

Wand of Magic Missiles.name: Wand of Magic Missiles
Wand of Magic Missiles.description:
Wand, Uncommon

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend no more than 3 charges to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMagicMissi]{Magic Missile} from it. For 1 charge, you cast the level 1 version of the spell. You can increase the spell's level by 1 for each additional charge you expend.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Wand of Paralysis.name: Wand of Paralysis
Wand of Paralysis.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can take a Magic action to expend 1 charge to cause a thin blue ray to streak from the tip toward a creature you can see within 60 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or have the &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] condition for 1 minute. At the end of each of the target's turns, it repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Wand of Polymorph.name: Wand of Polymorph
Wand of Polymorph.description:
Wand, Very Rare (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplPolymorph0]{Polymorph} (save DC 15) from it.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Wand of Secrets.name: Wand of Secrets
Wand of Secrets.description:
Wand, Uncommon

This wand has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While holding it, you can take a Magic action to expend 1 charge, and if a secret door or trap is within 60 feet of you, the wand pulses and points at the one nearest to you.

Wand of Web.name: Wand of Web
Wand of Web.description:
Wand, Uncommon (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWeb0000000]{Web} (save DC 13) from it.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

Wand of Wonder.name: Wand of Wonder
Wand of Wonder.description:
Wand, Rare (Requires Attunement)

This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can take a Magic action to expend 1 charge while choosing a point within 120 feet of yourself. That location becomes the point of origin of a spell or other magical effect determined by rolling on the Wand of Wonder Effects table. Spells cast from the wand have a save DC of 15. If a spell's maximum range is normally less than 120 feet, it becomes 120 feet when cast from the wand. If an effect has multiple possible subjects, the GM determines randomly which among them are affected.

Regaining Charges. The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll [[/r 1d20]]. On a 1, the wand crumbles into dust and is destroyed.

Wand of Wonder Effects Table

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.tables24.RollTable.dmgWandOfWonderE rollable caption=false]

Foundry Note

The actionable effects of the table are included as activities and implemented as much as possible in the table to provide flexibility in how you'd like to use them.

The Expend activity should be used for any effect which isn't implemented as an activity for tracking charge uses.

Wand of the War Mage, +1, +2, or +3.name: Wand of the War Mage, +1, +2, or +3
Wand of the War Mage, +1, +2, or +3.description:
@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbafcWand000000]{Wand}, Uncommon (+1), Rare (+2), or Very Rare (+3) (Requires Attunement by a Spellcaster)

While holding this wand, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls determined by the wand's rarity. In addition, you ignore &Reference[HalfCover] when making a spell attack roll.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Wand of the War Mage, +1, +2, or +3.name: Wand of the War Mage, +1, +2, or +3

Water (Pint).name: Water (Pint)
Water (Pint).description: If you don't drink sufficient water, you risk &Reference[dehydration].

Water Ring of Elemental Command.name: Water Ring of Elemental Command
Water Ring of Elemental Command.description:
Ring, Legendary (Requires Attunement)

Each Ring of Elemental Command is linked to one of the four Elemental Planes. The GM chooses or randomly determines the linked plane. For example, a Ring of Elemental Command (air) is linked to the Elemental Plane of Air.

Every Ring of Elemental Command has the following two properties:

Elemental Bane. While wearing the ring, you have Advantage on attack rolls against Elementals and they have Disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Elemental Compulsion. While wearing the ring, you can take a Magic action to try to compel an Elemental you see within 60 feet of yourself. The Elemental makes a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the Elemental has the &Reference[Charmed apply=false] condition until the start your next turn, and you determine what it does with its move and action on its next turn.

Elemental Focus. While wearing the ring, you benefit from additional properties corresponding to the ring's linked Elemental Plane:

Water. You know Aquan, you gain a Swim Speed of 60 feet, and you can breathe underwater.

Spellcasting. The ring has 5 charges and regains 1d4 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can cast a spell from it. Choose the spell from the list of available spells based on the Elemental Plane the ring is linked to, as shown in the following table. The table indicates how many charges you must expend to cast the spell, which has a save DC of 18.

Plane

Spells (Charges)

Water

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplCreateorDe]{Create or Destroy Water} (1 charge), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplIceStorm00]{Ice Storm} (2 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplTsunami000]{Tsunami} (5 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWallofIce0]{Wall of Ice} (3 charges), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplWaterWalk0]{Water Walk} (2 charges)

Water, fresh (Pint).name: Water, fresh (Pint)
Water, fresh (Pint).description: If you don't drink sufficient water, you risk &Reference[dehydration].

Waterskin.name: Waterskin
Waterskin.description: A Waterskin holds up to 4 pints. If you don't drink sufficient water, you risk &Reference[dehydration].

Weapon of Warning.name: Weapon of Warning
Weapon of Warning.description:
Weapon (Any Simple or Martial), Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

As long as this weapon is within your reach and you are attuned to it, you and allies within 30 feet of you gain the following benefits.

Alarm. The weapon magically awakens each subject who is sleeping naturally when combat begins. This benefit doesn't wake a subject from magically induced sleep.

Supernatural Readiness. Each subject has Advantage on its Initiative rolls.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Supernatural Readiness: Initiative Advan.name: Supernatural Readiness: Initiative Advantage
Supernatural Readiness: Initiative Advan.description: Each ally (including you) has Advantage on its Initiative rolls when within 30 feet.

Weapon, +1, +2, or +3.name: Weapon, +1, +2, or +3
Weapon, +1, +2, or +3.description:
Weapon (Any Simple or Martial), Uncommon (+1), Rare (+2), or Very Rare (+3)

You have a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. The bonus is determined by the weapon's rarity.

@Embed[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgFoundryRefere.JournalEntryPage.Ok4iCgD25ENgoRxE cite=false caption=false classes="hide-in-embed"]

Weaver's Tools.name: Weaver's Tools
Weaver's Tools.description:
Ability: Dexterity

Utilize: Mend a tear in clothing (DC 10), or sew a Tiny design (DC 10)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbarmPaddedArmo]{Padded Armor}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBasket00000]{Basket}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBedroll0000]{Bedroll}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagBlanket0000]{Blanket}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagClothesFine]{Fine Clothes}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagNet00000000]{Net}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRobe0000000]{Robe}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagRope0000000]{Rope}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagSack0000000]{Sack}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagString00000]{String}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagTent0000000]{Tent}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagClothesTrav]{Traveler's Clothes}

Well of Many Worlds.name: Well of Many Worlds
Well of Many Worlds.description:
Wondrous Item, Legendary

This fine black cloth, soft as silk, is folded up to the dimensions of a handkerchief. It unfolds into a circular sheet 6 feet in diameter.

You can take a Magic action to unfold the Well of Many Worlds and place it on a solid surface, whereupon it forms a two-way, 6-foot-diameter, circular portal to another world or plane of existence. Each time the item opens a portal, the DM decides where it leads. The portal remains open until a creature within 5 feet of it takes a Magic action to close it by taking hold of the edges of the cloth and folding it up.

Once the Well of Many Worlds has opened a portal, it can't do so again for [[/r 1d8 # Hours]] hours.

Wind Fan.name: Wind Fan
Wind Fan.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon

While holding this fan, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplGustofWind]{Gust of Wind} (save DC 13) from it. Each subsequent time the fan is used before the next dawn, it has a cumulative 20 percent chance of not working; if the fan fails to work, it tears into useless, nonmagical tatters.

Roll for Chance of Not Working: [[/r 1d5cs>@item.uses.spent]]

Foundry Note

Each of use of Gust of Wind expends a use of this item and is reset at dawn. The inline roll above rolls 1d5 and checks if the value is higher than the number of uses to handle the cumulative 20 percent chance of not working. It will return "1" if it's successful and "0" if it fails.

Winged Boots.name: Winged Boots
Winged Boots.description:
Wondrous Item, Uncommon (Requires Attunement)

These boots have 4 charges and regain 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the boots, you can take a Magic action to expend 1 charge, gaining a Fly Speed of 30 feet for 1 hour. If you are flying when the duration expires, you descend at a rate of 30 feet per round until you land.

Winged.name: Winged
Winged.description: The wings lasts for 1 hour or until you end the effect early as a Magic action. The wings give you a Fly Speed of 60 feet.

Wings of Flying.name: Wings of Flying
Wings of Flying.description:
Wondrous Item, Rare (Requires Attunement)

While wearing this cloak, you can take a Magic action to turn the cloak into a pair of wings on your back. The wings lasts for 1 hour or until you end the effect early as a Magic action. The wings give you a Fly Speed of 60 feet. If you are aloft when the wings disappear, you fall. When the wings disappear, you can't use them again for [[/r 1d12]] hours.

Winged.name: Winged
Winged.description: The wings lasts for 1 hour or until you end the effect early as a Magic action. The wings give you a Fly Speed of 60 feet.

Woodcarver's Tools.name: Woodcarver's Tools
Woodcarver's Tools.description:
Ability: Dexterity

Utilize: Carve a pattern in wood (DC 10)

Craft: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepClub000000]{Club}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepGreatclub0]{Greatclub}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepQuartersta]{Quarterstaff}, Ranged weapons (except Pistol, Musket, and Sling), Arcane Focus, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoArrows0000]{Arrows}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoBolts00000]{Bolts}, Druidic Focus, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagInkPen00000]{Ink Pen}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbamoNeedles000]{Needles}

Wooden staff.name: Wooden staff
Wooden staff.description:
A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagDruidicFocu]{Druidic Focus} takes one of the forms in the Druidic Focuses table and is carved, tied with ribbon, or painted to channel primal magic. A Druid or Ranger can use such an object as a Spellcasting Focus.

This item also functions as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbwepQuartersta]{Quarterstaff}

Foundry Note

This item has been configured with the additional properties of a Quarterstaff.

Wyvern Poison.name: Wyvern Poison
Wyvern Poison.description:
Injury Poison

A creature subjected to Wyvern Poison makes a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Yew wand.name: Yew wand
Yew wand.description: A @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.equipment24.Item.phbagDruidicFocu]{Druidic Focus} takes one of the forms in the Druidic Focuses table and is carved, tied with ribbon, or painted to channel primal magic. A Druid or Ranger can use such an object as a Spellcasting Focus.

phbagBedroll0000.name: Bedroll
phbagBedroll0000.description: A Bedroll sleeps one Small or Medium creature. While in a Bedroll, you automatically succeed on saving throws against extreme cold (see @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.content24.JournalEntry.dmgDmsToolbox000]{Gameplay Toolbox}).

phbagPotionofHea.name: Potion of Healing
phbagPotionofHea.description: This potion is a magic item. As a Bonus Action, you can drink it or administer it to another creature within 5 feet of yourself. The creature that drinks the magical red fluid in this vial regains 2d4 + 2 Hit Points.

phbagRations0000.name: Rations
phbagRations0000.description: Rations consist of travel-ready food, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts. See &Reference[Malnutrition] in the rules glossary for the risks of not eating.
